alert.note: Alert for Mercer; Monroe; Summers (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 4:34PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Giles, southeastern Summers, southeastern Mercer and southwestern Monroe Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 434 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Willowton, or near Narrows, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pearisburg... Narrows... Peterstown... Rich Creek... Oakvale... Glen Lyn... and Red Sulphur Spring. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
